results.title: Airplanes and how they fly. - Rev. ed.
results.brief_description: Explains basic principles involved in launching, flying, and controlling an airplane. Uses animation to demonstrate how the shape of the airfoil produces lift during flight. Also features some of the most modern aircraft in the world.

results.title: Earthquakes and volcanoes. - Rev. ed.
results.brief_description: This film demonstrates how volcanoes and earthquakes occur in the same place in certain regions of the world. It suggests that they have a common cause: the friction and collision between the plates in motion which cover the earth’s surface. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: The Magic house
results.brief_description: Two parents abandon their responsibilities: at first their children are happy with this but over several days the attitude of the girl changes. Open-ended film which leaves many possibilities for discussion. Good for values study. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Animals see in many ways
results.creator_credit: Norman Bean and Norman Bean Films
results.brief_description: Presents a basic introduction to the ways in which different animals see. Shows that some animals have simple eyes and some have compound eyes, highlighting how these two eye-types function and how they aid the particular animal in functioning within its environment, eg the differences between the eye-types of hunted and hunter animals. Also defines lens, retina and iris. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

Also defines lens, retina and iris. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Animals hear in many ways
results.creator_credit: Norman Bean, Film Associates of California and Norman Bean Films
results.brief_description: Animals hear when sound vibrations produce similar vibrations in their own bodies. This film shows how different parts of animals’ bodies may be specially adapted to receive the vibrations. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Animal migration
results.brief_description: Describes the migratory patterns of animals such as the mountain sheep, monarch butterfly, whale, elephant seal, salmon and arctic tern. Examines the reasons for animals migrating, the ways in which they navigate, and the scientific methods used to study migration. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Cambridgeshire communities: an economic way to provide community education
results.brief_description: In creating Village Colleges in England, Henry Morris pioneered the idea of augmenting premises at local schools for use by the whole community. In recent years there has been an escalation in the wider use of school premises, sometimes for economic and sometimes for social reasons. this film argues that, given the right administrative structure (unitary control with a strong local community association) and a relatively small amount of additional finance, schools can provide ideal centres for the whole community - its children, its adults and its older people. Commentary by David Cass; photography by Chris Ware.

results.title: The Incredible San Francisco artists' soapbox derby
results.creator_credit: Amanda C Pope and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: In the spring of 1975, 104 artists of San Francisco let fly with imagination and creativity and built 75 “cars” and 32 trophies for an artists’ annual soapbox (billycart) derby. Entries were built from such diverse materials as wire, papier-mache, sage-brush and bread. They raised $20,000 for the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art.
